SEARCH
Module JBubbleBobble
Package game.model.entities

Class Entity

java.lang.Object
game.model.entities.Entity
Direct Known Subclasses:
Fruit, MovingEntity, Powerup, Tile
public abstract class Entity extends Object
The Entity class serves as the base class for all game entities. It provides the basic properties and methods needed for collision detection, positioning, and size management of entities in the game world.

  • Constructor Details

    • Entity

      public Entity(float x, float y, float width, float height, char code)
      Constructs an Entity with specified position, dimensions, and code.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the entity.
      y - The y-coordinate of the entity.
      width - The width of the entity.
      height - The height of the entity.
      code - The unique code representing the entity.

    • Entity

      public Entity(float x, float y, char code)
      Constructs an Entity with specified position and code. The width and height are set to the default tile size minus 1.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the entity.
      y - The y-coordinate of the entity.
      code - The unique code representing the entity.

  • Method Details

    • checkCollision

      public static <T extends Entity, U extends Entity> Optional<U> checkCollision(T entity, U otherEntity)
      Checks if two entities collide with each other.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the first entity.
      U - The type of the second entity.
      Parameters:
      entity - The first entity.
      otherEntity - The second entity to check collision against.
      Returns:
      true if the entities collide, false otherwise.

    • checkCollision

      public static <T extends Entity, U extends Entity> Optional<U> checkCollision(T entity, List<U> list)
      Checks if an entity collides with any entity in a list.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the entity to check.
      U - The type of entities in the list.
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity to check for collision.
      list - The list of entities to check against.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the first entity in the list that collides with the given entity, or Optional.empty() if no collision is detected.

    • checkBottomCollision

      public static <T extends Entity, U extends Entity> Optional<U> checkBottomCollision(T entity, List<U> list)
      Checks if an entity collides with the bottom of any entity in a list.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the entity to check.
      U - The type of entities in the list.
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity to check for bottom collision.
      list - The list of entities to check against.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the first entity in the list that collides with the bottom of the given entity, or Optional.empty() if no collision is detected.

    • checkCollisions

      public static <T extends Entity, U extends Entity> Optional<Entity[]> checkCollisions(List<T> list1, List<U> list2)
      Checks if an entity collides with any entity in a list.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the entity to check.
      U - The type of entities in the list.
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity to check for collision.
      list - The list of entities to check against.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the first entity in the list that collides with the given entity, or Optional.empty() if no collision is detected.

    • getDistanceFrom

      public float getDistanceFrom(Entity entity)
      Calculates the distance from this entity to another entity.
      Parameters:
      entity - The other entity to calculate the distance from.
      Returns:
      The distance between the closest edges of the two entities.
